title: Bishop of Portsmouth (Anglican)
text:
The Bishop of Portsmouth is the <a href="Ordinary%20%28officer%29">Ordinary</a> of the <a href="Church%20of%20England">Church of England</a> <a href="Anglican%20Diocese%20of%20Portsmouth">Diocese of Portsmouth</a> in the <a href="Province%20of%20Canterbury">Province of Canterbury</a>.
The diocese covers south-east <a href="Hampshire">Hampshire</a> and the <a href="Isle%20of%20Wight">Isle of Wight</a> and has its <a href="Episcopal%20see">see</a> in the <a href="Portsmouth">City of Portsmouth</a>, where the <a href="Cathedra">seat</a> is located at the <a href="Portsmouth%20Cathedral">Cathedral Church of Saint Thomas of Canterbury</a> which was elevated to cathedral status in 1927. The bishop's residence is Bishopsgrove, <a href="Fareham">Fareham</a>.
The office of bishop was created in 1927 when the new diocese was formed from part of the <a href="Diocese%20of%20Winchester">Diocese of Winchester</a>. <a href="Jonathan%20Frost">Jonathan Frost</a> has been the Bishop of Portsmouth since his <a href="canonical%20election">election</a> was <a href="confirmation%20of%20bishops">confirmed</a> on 18 January 2022.
